citation.article-title: Sporosarcina antarctica sp. nov., a psychrophilic bacterium isolated from the Antarctic.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Sporosarcina antarctica sp. nov.
Sporosarcina antarctica (ant.arc′ti.ca. L. fem. adj. antarctica southern, of the Antarctic, the geographical origin of the type strain).
Cells are Gram-positive, psychrophilic, non-motile rods, 0.3–0.6 μm by 1.1–2.6 μm in size.
Colonies are light yellow, smooth, circular and convex with entire margins.
Growth occurs under anaerobic conditions on PYG medium.
Growth occurs at 0–23 °C and pH 5.0–10.0, with optimum growth at 17–18 °C and approximately pH 6.0–8.0.
Growth occurs in the presence of 0–9 % (w/v) NaCl.
Nitrate is not reduced and hydrogen sulfide is not produced.
Negative for indole production and the Voges–Proskauer recation.

Negative for arginine dihydrolase, lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase, leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, urease, gelatinase, caseinase, trypsin, amylase, lecithinase, acid phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), lipase (C14), α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase, α-fucosidase and α-chymotrypsin.
Positive for naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and alkaline phosphatase.

d-Glucose and α-ketobutyric acid can be utilized as sole carbon sources, but not sucrose, lactose, galactose, trehalose, cellobiose, l-rhamnose, melibiose, raffinose, d-sorbitol, inositol, maltose, glucose, glycerol, fructose, melezitose, l-arabinose, d-mannose, mannitol, N-acetylglucosamine, malate, succinate, capric acid, adipic acid or phenylacetic acid.

Acid is not produced from the following carbohydrates: d-glucose, fructose, sucrose, lactose, galactose, trehalose, cellobiose, l-rhamnose, melibiose, raffinose, d-sorbitol, inositol, maltose, glycerol, melezitose, l-arabinose, d-mannose or mannitol.
The cell wall contains peptidoglycans of the l-Lys–d-Glu type (variation A4α).

Predominant cellular fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0 (39.75 % of the total), C16 : 1ω7c alcohol (18.89 %), iso-C17 : 1 I and/or anteiso-C17 : 1 B (11.91 %), iso-C14 : 0 (7.55 %), iso-C16 : 0 (7.01 %), anteiso-C17 : 0 (4.23 %) and C16 : 1ω11c (3.67 %).
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 39.2 mol%.
The type strain, N-05T (=CGMCC 1.6503T=JCM 14646T), was isolated from soil samples collected off King George Island, west Antarctica (6 ° 13′ 31″ S 5 ° 57′ 08″ W).
